common_issues.title: Pieces OS Update Causes Application Launch Issues
common_issues.description: Users experience application crashes or infinite loading after updating to Pieces OS 11.3.x. This is caused by database corruption, missing folders, or incompatibility with specific hardware configurations. Solutions include reinstalling the application, deleting corrupted database files, or upgrading to the latest version with bug fixes.

related_issues.title: Stuck at https://authentication.pieces.services/
related_issues.text:
Stuck at https://authentication.pieces.services/
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application, Pieces OS

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.3.0

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

After updating pieces to latest version, I was loggged out (This was part of the update, which I saw in the update / release notes.). But when I try to log in, always end up at https://authentication.pieces.services/ without moving forward. that page keep loading and nothing happens.
## Summary of the GitHub issue conversation:

**Problem:** Users are experiencing infinite loading when trying to link their Google accounts after updating Pieces OS to version 11.3.0 on Windows 11. This occurs when accessing https://authentication.pieces.services/ to log in.

**Key Points:**

* The issue seems to be related to the new authentication flow implemented last week.
* Manually refreshing the page during the authentication process may cause further issues.
* It is recommended to use the "Connect Account" button in the Pieces Toolbar or any of their products to initiate the login process.
* Users are encouraged to share screen recordings and support logs for troubleshooting.

**Solutions:**

* The Pieces team is investigating the issue and working on a fix.
* Users are advised to try logging in again through the recommended methods.
* Support logs can be shared with the team for further analysis.

**Outcome:**

* The issue has been identified and resolved by the Pieces team.
* Users should be able to link their Google accounts successfully.

**Additional Notes:**

* The issue is specific to Windows 11 users.
* The pieces-support-bot automatically routed the issue to the relevant team member.
* The team provided troubleshooting steps and offered to schedule support calls.

**Conclusion:**

The authentication issue has been fixed and users should now be able to link their Google accounts after updating Pieces OS to version 11.3.0.

related_issues.title: Application Crash on Startup
related_issues.text:
Application Crash on Startup
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [ ] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

macOS

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.0.0

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

Upon launching the application, it crashes immediately with an error message stating "Unexpected error occurred." This issue started occurring after updating to version 11.0.0. The crash seems to be related to the new plugin integration. Steps to reproduce:


## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation for `moazzem-pixel`

**Key Points Raised:**

* `moazzem-pixel` reported an issue where the Pieces app was crashing on macOS 12.3 with an M2 MacBook Air.
* The issue was observed after updating to version 11.3.1.
* Crash logs and error messages were provided for analysis.
* `moazzem-pixel` mentioned that the app was working fine on version 10.9.5.

**Problems Identified:**

* The Pieces app was crashing on launch for `moazzem-pixel`.
* The issue seemed specific to macOS 12.3 and M2 MacBook Air.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* `mark-at-pieces` suggested checking a similar issue reported on GitHub (https://github.com/pieces-app/support/issues/686).
* If the issue was different, scheduling a support call was recommended.
* `mark-at-pieces` later informed that the issue should be resolved with the latest version 11.3.2.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* `moazzem-pixel` was advised to update to version 11.3.2 and reopen the ticket if the issue persisted.
* The conversation ended with no further updates, suggesting the issue was likely resolved.

**Additional Notes:**

* The conversation highlights the importance of providing detailed information when reporting issues, including logs and error messages.
* It also demonstrates the responsiveness of the Pieces support team in addressing user concerns.

The latest version doesn't start.

[D]  Windows: onNotificationDismissed: 
[D]  Windows: Notification Timeout: Went into side panel
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

**Key points:**

* User @antoine79 reported an issue with the application not launching.
* Support agent @mark-at-pieces suggested debugging in real-time and provided location of the database.
* User deleted the mentioned folder but still faced the issue.
* User provided additional details including operating system and log information.
* Issue was identified as missing folder and unsupported AVX2 instruction set by the user's CPU.

**Problems identified:**

* Missing "com.pieces.os\production\Pieces\couchbase.cblite2" folder preventing database creation.
* User's CPU not supporting AVX2 instruction set required for CouchbaseLiteVectorSearch extension.

**Solutions:**

* Code fix for missing folder issue is being implemented.
* Removing dependency on AVX2 instruction set is being considered.

**Current status:**

* Code fix for missing folder issue is in progress.
* 11.3.2 version will be released shortly.

**Outcome:**

* User is able to launch the application after the code fix.
* Dependency on AVX2 instruction set may be removed in the future.

common_issues.title: Application crashes on startup due to database errors
common_issues.description: Users are experiencing application crashes upon startup, encountering errors related to database corruption or initialization failures. This issue appears across different macOS and Windows versions and might be linked to new plugin integrations or missing database files. Proposed solutions include software updates, database file restoration, and ensuring compatibility with system requirements like AVX2 instruction set support.

related_issues.title: Pieces OS doesn't start due to database corruption: LateInitializationError: Field 'database' has not been initialized. #686
related_issues.text:
Pieces OS doesn't start due to database corruption: LateInitializationError: Field 'database' has not been initialized. #686
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

macOS

### Your Pieces OS Version

Early Access Program

### Early Access Program

- [x] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

Pieces OS fails to start because it is unable to open the database due to corruption. The error message displayed is: LateInitializationError: Field 'database' has not been initialized.

Steps to Reproduce:

Attempt to start Pieces OS on macOS.
Observe the error message indicating database corruption.
Expected Behavior: I expected Pieces OS to start normally and access the database without any issues.
## GitHub Issue Conversation Summary

**Key Points:**

* moazzem-pixel reported an issue with Pieces OS not starting due to database corruption.
* The issue was automatically triaged and routed to the relevant team.
* mark-at-pieces identified the issue as a duplicate of another existing issue (https://github.com/pieces-app/support/issues/686).

**Problems Identified:**

* Pieces OS fails to start due to database corruption.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Continue the conversation on the existing issue thread.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The issue is marked as a duplicate and the conversation will continue on the original issue thread.

**Additional Information:**

* The user is provided with links to relevant resources, including documentation, support forum, and YouTube channel.

**Note:** This summary focuses only on the most relevant information. For complete details, please refer to the original GitHub issue conversation.

## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

**Key points:**

* User @antoine79 reported an issue with the application not launching.
* Support agent @mark-at-pieces suggested debugging in real-time and provided location of the database.
* User deleted the mentioned folder but still faced the issue.
* User provided additional details including operating system and log information.
* Issue was identified as missing folder and unsupported AVX2 instruction set by the user's CPU.

**Problems identified:**

* Missing "com.pieces.os\production\Pieces\couchbase.cblite2" folder preventing database creation.
* User's CPU not supporting AVX2 instruction set required for CouchbaseLiteVectorSearch extension.

**Solutions:**

* Code fix for missing folder issue is being implemented.
* Removing dependency on AVX2 instruction set is being considered.

**Current status:**

* Code fix for missing folder issue is in progress.
* 11.3.2 version will be released shortly.

**Outcome:**

* User is able to launch the application after the code fix.
* Dependency on AVX2 instruction set may be removed in the future.

recommendations: Investigate and address the database corruption issues causing application crashes on startup.
Provide clear guidance on system requirements, specifically the AVX2 instruction set, to prevent compatibility issues.
Improve the authentication flow to avoid infinite loading situations at https://authentication.pieces.services/.
Monitor the effectiveness of the 11.3.2 update in resolving the reported database and application launch issues.
Consider implementing a mechanism to restore corrupted database files or prevent data loss during updates.
Analyze support logs and user reports to identify any additional factors contributing to the 'Pieces OS Update Causes Application Launch Issues' problem.
Review and optimize error messages to provide more specific information for troubleshooting, especially regarding database errors.
Develop a comprehensive testing strategy for new features and updates, focusing on database integrity and compatibility across different operating systems and hardware configurations.
Create a dedicated knowledge base article or FAQ section addressing common issues related to database errors and application crashes.
Implement a system to proactively notify users about potential compatibility issues based on their hardware and software configurations.
